snippet: Student Opinion | Do you care how the colleges you're considering are ranked?
abstract: Student Opinion | Do you care how the colleges you're considering are ranked?

byline.original: By LILY ALTAVENA and HOLLY EPSTEIN OJALVO

lead_paragraph: Claremont McKenna College, in California, acknowledged this week that for six years, an admissions officer had fudged its SAT scores, used in the U.S. News and World Report college rankings. The reporting of falsely inflated scores is believed to have raised the college's rankings. Do rankings matter to you? Why do they play such a large role in admissions? When you think about prospective schools, how much do you care about their rankings?
